How is it a “fair deal” if it’s higher than the average market range? If a car is priced within a certain proximity of the average market range, we consider it “fair” because there may be details about this car that are unknown to Cars.com. Examples include aftermarket add-ons, pristine condition evaluations, and additional factors that increase value. We always recommend contacting the seller of this car for more information.
